result.execSummary:
The defendant DLeon Lopez Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection. DOC to collect those moneatry sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of funds.

superMiscConds.notes:
Seek and maintain employment that doesn't interfere with school.
Obtain GED or HSED.
Court advises the defendant he cannot possess firearms or body armor.

No violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with the victim. Defendant to have no contact with the victim during the entire length of sentence.

Must provide a DNA sample if not previously provided and pay the DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.
Pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution.
Sex offender treatment or counseling as recommended.
Drug or alcohol treatment or counseling as recommended.
Restitution set at 0.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Defendant must comply with sex offender reporting requirements for 15 years.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant DLeon Lopez Johnson in court with attorney Russell Dennis Bohach.  Defendant DLeon Lopez Johnson in custody.  Joshua M. Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.  Corrections made to the presentence investigation report.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by counsel and defendant. COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms or body armor, he must provide a DNA sample if not previously provided and pay the DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 54 months with 297 days credit -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 30 months  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 24 months; pay costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  1) no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution; 3) sex offender treatment or counseling as recommended; 4) drug or alcohol treatment or counseling as recommended; 5) no contact with the victim; 6) seek and maintain employment that doesn't interfere with school; 7) obtain GED or HSED.

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay the surcharge - if not already done
-  DOC to collect those monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of funds;
- restitution set at -0-;
- defendant to have no contact with the victim during the entire length of the sentence.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping;
- the defendant must comply with sex offender reporting requirements for 15 years. 

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.
Sentencing Memorandum received and filed./ds

Defendant DLeon Lopez Johnson in court with attorney Russell Dennis Bohach.  Defendant DLeon Lopez Johnson in custody.  Joshua M. Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
  Defendant sworn in. 
AS TO COUNT  1- 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting and Child sex offender working with children.
Court ordered a presentence investigation with a recommendation.  Order for presentence investigation signed and filed. Defense will also submitt a private PSI. 
Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody.  
Parties advised as of August 1, 2014 this matter is reassigned to Judge Konkol, Br 44 in room  506 of the Safety Building. 
Copy of Waiver Order received and filed. 
Case adjourned to Branch 44.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-18-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Case scheduled for plea hearing today.  Defense counsl had a conflict at 2:30 p.m. in children's court.  State was in Br 10 with a sentencing and could not appear prior to 2:30 p.m.   Case is adjourned to Br 12 for plea hearing on 7/15/2014 at 8:30 a.m.   Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Letter from Attorney Bohach confirming the plea date was moved to 07/14/2014 at 1:30pm.

Attorney Russell D Bohach in court via telephone, defendant DLeon Lopez Johnson not in court, in custody.  Joshua M Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin earlier.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Defense counsel and the state are still working on resolving this matter and defense request a short adjournment.  Br 12 is in trial today and wouldn't be able to hear this matter.   Case is adjourned to Br 12.  Plea hearing scheduled for 07-14-2014 at 01:30 pm.
Letter from defense counsel received and filed.  Defense may appear via telephone for the hearing on 5/30/2014.   Deputy Court Clerk kmh.

Attorney Russell D Bohach in court, defendant DLeon Lopez Johnson not in court, in custody.  Joshua M Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Defense has received an offer and discovery.  Defense request a plea hearing.   Case is adjourned to Br 12.  Plea hearing scheduled for 05-30-2014 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 04-22-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant DLeon Lopez Johnson in court with Attorney Maayan Silver, appearing for Attorney Russell Dennis Bohach.  Defendant DLeon Lopez Johnson in custody.  Joshua M. Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Branch 12, Judge David Borowski presiding.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 12.
Clerk:  jms

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SKM.

Defendant DLeon Lopez Johnson in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Defendant DLeon Lopez Johnson in custody.  Lucy J. Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   
DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.
